title: Society of Women Engineers (SWE) Scholarship
eligibility: Women in accredited engineering or computer science programs (undergraduate or graduate).
description: Provides financial assistance to women studying engineering, technology, and computer science.

title: Google Women Techmakers Scholars Program
eligibility: Female undergraduate or graduate students in CS, CE, or a related technical field.
description: Scholarships, a professional retreat, and access to a global community network for women in tech.

title: Software Engineering Internship
eligibility: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree program in computer science or related field.
description: A 12-week paid internship to work on real projects that ship to millions of users.

title: Grace Hopper Celebration
eligibility: Open to all, with scholarships available for students and faculty.
deadline: Scholarship applications typically open in January.
description: The world's largest gathering of women technologists, offering networking, mentorship, and career opportunities.

title: Ada Lovelace Fellowship
eligibility: Second-year PhD students from underrepresented groups (including women) in computing.
description: A three-year fellowship for PhD students that includes tuition coverage and a research stipend.

title: NCWIT Award for Aspirations in Computing
eligibility: U.S. high school students who self-identify as women, genderqueer, or non-binary.
description: Recognizes high school women for their computing aspirations and accomplishments with awards, scholarships, and internship opportunities.

title: Data Science Internship
eligibility: Students pursuing a degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Statistics, or Applied Math.
description: Work with Apple's data science teams on challenging problems that impact products and services.

title: Palantir Women in Technology Scholarship
eligibility: Female students enrolled full-time in an undergraduate or graduate program, majoring in a STEM field.
description: A scholarship and mentorship program designed to support and encourage women in STEM.

title: Break Through Tech AI Program
eligibility: Undergraduate women and underrepresented genders in tech.
description: A program that provides skills training, portfolio projects, and industry connections to help students launch careers in AI/ML.

title: Cybersecurity Internship
eligibility: U.S. citizen students pursuing degrees in cybersecurity, computer science, or related fields.
description: Gain real-world experience in cybersecurity and intelligence through various paid internship programs.

title: Women Who Code Conference Grant
eligibility: Active members of the Women Who Code community.
description: Grants to help cover the cost of attending technical conferences, promoting professional development.

title: Rewriting the Code Fellowship
eligibility: Undergraduate and graduate women in tech.
description: A year-long program offering mentorship, skill-building workshops, and access to a community of peers and partner companies for internships.

title: BHW Women in STEM Scholarship
eligibility: Women who are pursuing an undergraduate or master's degree and are majoring in a STEM field.
description: An annual scholarship awarded to a woman who demonstrates a passion for technology and is pursuing a degree in a STEM field.

title: Open Source Promotion Plan
eligibility: Students interested in contributing to open-source software.
description: A global program that offers students stipends to write code for open-source projects during the summer.

title: IEEE Women in Engineering International Leadership Conference (WIE ILC)
eligibility: Open to all, with a focus on mid-to-senior level women in tech.
description: A conference providing professional development opportunities for women in engineering and technology.

title: Amazon Future Engineer Scholarship
eligibility: High school seniors from underserved communities planning to study computer science.
description: A $40,000 scholarship and a guaranteed paid internship at Amazon after their freshman year of college.
